defaultApiKey.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
defaultApiKey.description: Identity domain ID (on Oracle Public Cloud) or tenant name (on Oracle Cloud Machine)

CommonHeaderTenant.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
CommonHeaderTenant.description: Name of the identity domain for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

CommonPathIdentityDomainId.name: identityDomainId
CommonPathIdentityDomainId.description: Name of the identity domain for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

CommonPathServiceId.name: serviceId
CommonPathServiceId.description: The user-defined name of the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance.

CommonPathCredentialName.name: credentialName
CommonPathCredentialName.description: Credential name associated with the SSH public key. The only supported credential name is vmspublickey.

CommonQueryServiceName.name: serviceName
CommonQueryServiceName.description: Name of a MySQL Cloud Service instance. The response is limited to credentials for this service instance. If omitted, credentials for all MySQL Cloud Service instances in the identity domain are returned.

CommonQueryLimitRowCount.name: limitRowCount
CommonQueryLimitRowCount.description: The maximum number of SSH keys to include in the response. If omitted, a maximum of 50 keys are included in the response.

CommonQueryOffset.name: offset
CommonQueryOffset.description: The number of SSH keys to skip before starting to collect keys for the response. If omitted, zero keys are skipped so that the response begins with the first key.

CommonQueryCredName.name: credname
CommonQueryCredName.description: The only supported credential name value is 'vmspublickey', which is used by default.

get.description: Returns a list of all available patches for a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

put.description: Applies a patch to a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: patchId
parameters.description: Patch ID. The patch ID can be retrieved via getting the list of available patches.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body contains details about the patch request. A request body is required, so either pass in the desired options, or use an empty object {}.

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns a list of all applied patches for a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns information about the specified patching or rollback operation for a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Unique ID of a patching or rollback operation.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

put.description:
Performs a precheck operation to identity potential issues that might prevent the specified patch from successfully completing. Specifically, the patching precheck reports on the following conditions:
  • Disk space shortage
  • Database connectivity failure
  • Server access failure
  • Storage access failure

Prechecks do not check whether another administration task (such as backup, restoration, or scaling) is in progress, which would prevent patching.

parameters.name: patchId
parameters.description: ID of the patch to precheck.

202.description:
Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

The Location header returns a REST URI that can be used to access the status of the patching precheck operation.

get.summary: View Status of All Patching Precheck Operations
get.description: Returns the status of all patching precheck operations that have been executed against the MySQL Cloud Service instance.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.summary: View Status of a Patching Precheck Operation
get.description: Returns the status of a patching precheck operation.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Job ID of the operation that was returned when the patching precheck was initiated.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

put.description: Rolls back a patch operation that was applied to a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: rollbackId
parameters.description: ID of the rollback that is associated to the completed patching operation.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body contains a note about the rollback request.

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description:
This endpoint is not available on Oracle Cloud at Customer.

Returns all tags and tag assignments in the specified identity domain ID.

Use the optional ?services query parameter to list tags for one or more specific service instances.

Use the optional ?tagFilter query parameter to provide a search criteria based on tags.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: services
parameters.description:
When set to a specific service type and service name in the format service_type.instance_name, the response includes tags and assignments for the specified instance only. Use a comma separated list to get information for two or more service instances.

For example:

  • MySQLCS.ExampleInstance
  • MySQLCS.ExampleInstance,MySQLCS.MyInstance01
  • MySQLCS.ExampleInstance,DBaaS.MyDBInstance

parameters.name: tagFilter
parameters.description:
An expression using tag keys and values for filtering search results. Only results that satisfy the expression are returned in a search.

When creating your filter expression:

  • Use the percent sign (%) to match multiple characters.
  • Use the underscore character (_) to match a single character.
  • Precede a literal character by a backslash character (\) if a key or value contains a literal percent sign (%), apostrophe or single quote ('), or underscore (_).

Valid expressions include:

  • 'foo':'bar' - Finds all tags and assignments that have a key of 'foo' and a value of 'bar'
  • 'ora\_%':'%prod%' - Finds all tags and assignments that have a key starting with 'ora_' and a value containing 'prod'.
  • 'haMode' - Finds all tags and assignments that have a tag key of 'haMode'
  • 'ora\_%' - Finds all tags and assignments that a tag key starting with 'ora_'
  • 'site':'pe_r' - Uses the underscore wildcard to wildcard-match only a single character. For example, site=pear or site=peer is a match. site=pepper is not a match.
  • 'foo':'' - Finds all tags and assignments that have a tag key of 'foo' and an empty string as the value.
  • 'accuracy':'100\%' - Uses the literal percent sign in a value, so that it is not interpreted as a wildcard match.
  • 'type':'Abe\'s test' - Uses the apostrophe (single quote) in a key or value.
  • 'key\_contains\_underscores':'value\_does\_too' - Uses underscores in a key or value, so that they are not interpreted as single-character wildcards.

200.description: OK.

400.description:
Bad request.

If you get the message SM-UI-PROXY when you use the percent sign (%) to match multiple characters, this means the percent sign must be percent-encoded as %25. Try the command again using percent-encoding for the percent character.

post.description:
This endpoint is not available on Oracle Cloud at Customer.

Creates instance tags and assigns them to existing resources in the same request. You can also create instance tags without creating assignments.

Note: This endpoint can be used to assign existing account non-metering tags to resources. The endpoint cannot be used to assign existing account metering tags, or create account tags of any type.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the tags to create and the services to assign the tags to.

200.description: OK.

put.description:
This endpoint is not available on Oracle Cloud at Customer.

Deletes one or more instance tags.

Set the optional ?force query parameter to true to allow tags to be deleted even if they are assigned to resources.

Note: This endpoint cannot be used to delete account tags of any type.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description:
Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) tags to be deleted if the tags are assigned to resources. Default is false (do not delete if the specified tags are assigned to resources). Set to true to allow tags to be deleted even if there are tag assignments.

Also, the request will fail (false) or not fail (true) if any of the specified tags are not found.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the tags to delete.

204.description:
No content.

Successfully deleted one or more tags. There is no response body.

400.description:
Bad request.

An attempt was made to delete a tag that cannot be removed (for example, a system-provided tag cannot be deleted).

404.description:
Not found.

No tags with the specified key/value pair were found, and the force query parameter was not set to true.

delete.description:
This endpoint is not available on Oracle Cloud at Customer.

Deletes all instance tags that have the specified key.

Set the optional ?removeAssignments query parameter to true to remove all tags and any existing assignments that match the specified tag key.

Note: This endpoint cannot be used to delete account tags of any type.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: tagKey
parameters.description: Tag key.

parameters.name: removeAssignments
parameters.description: Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) deletion if there are tag assignments that match the specified key.

204.description:
No Content.

Successfully deleted one or more tags. There is no response body.

400.description:
Bad request.

An attempt was made to delete a tag that cannot be removed (for example, a system-provided tag cannot be deleted).

404.description:
Not found.

No tags with the specified key were found.

409.description:
Conflict.

One or more tags are assigned to one or more resources, and the removeAssignments query parameter was not set to true.

delete.description:
This endpoint is not available on Oracle Cloud at Customer.

Deletes the tag that has the specified key and value. The value may be an empty string to match a tag that has an empty value.

Set the optional ?removeAssignments query parameter to true to remove the tag and any existing assignments that match the specified key and value.

Note: This endpoint cannot be used to delete account tags of any type.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: tagKey
parameters.description: Tag key.

parameters.name: tagValue
parameters.description: Tag value.

parameters.name: removeAssignments
parameters.description: Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) deletion if there are tag assignments that match the specified key/value pair.

204.description:
No Content.

Successfully deleted the tag. There is no response body.

400.description:
Bad request.

An attempt was made to delete a tag that cannot be removed (for example, a system-provided tag cannot be deleted).

404.description:
Not found.

No tag with the specified key/value was found.

409.description:
Conflict.

The tag is assigned to one or more resources, and the removeAssignments query parameter was not set to true.

put.description:
This endpoint is not available on Oracle Cloud at Customer.

Creates and deletes instance tag assignments in the same request.

Set the ?createTagsIfNeeded query parameter to true to create new tags if the tag assignments in the payload contain tags that do not yet exist.

Set the optional ?force query parameter to true to force the request to complete even if any specified tags, service resources, or tag assignments are not found.

Note: This endpoint can be used to unassign or assign existing account non-metering tags to resources. The endpoint cannot be used to unassign or assign existing account metering tags, or create account tags of any type.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) the request to complete.

parameters.name: createTagsIfNeeded
parameters.description: Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) tags to be created.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description:
The request body defines the tag assignments to create and delete.

Alternatively, you can omit TagsToUnassign and deleteAssignmentsFrom to just create tag assignments. Or you can omit TagsToAssign and createAssignmentsTo to just delete tag assignments.

200.description: OK.

post.description: Starts an on-demand backup operation on a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body contains optional options for the on-demand backup request.

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns a list of backup operations performed on a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns information about a performed backup operation on a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID.

parameters.name: includeLinkedDetails
parameters.description:
Flag that specifies whether to include information (true) or exclude information about related backups (false). When set to true:
  • For a full backup, includes information about all incremental backups performed since the last full backup.
  • For an incremental backup, includes information about the previous full backup.
Defaults to false, excluding information about related backups.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

post.description: Deletes a backup of a MySQL Cloud Service instance. This is an asynchronous operation.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body contains details of the delete backup request. You must specify at least one attribute.

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

404.description: Not found. Returned if the backup does not exist.

get.description: Returns information about all deleted backups for a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns information about a deleted backup for a MySQL Cloud Service instance, based on the job ID of the operation that deleted the backup.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Job ID of the operation that deleted the backup.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

400.description: Bad Request. Returned if the job ID does not exist.

post.description: Starts a restore operation on a MySQL Cloud Service Instance using a specific point in time specified by either a specific backupId or timestamp.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the details of the restoration operation request.

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes, for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description:
Returns a list of restore operations performed on a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

By default, only successful restoration operations are included. Set the includeFailed query parameter to true to include both successful and failed restoration operations.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes, for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.summary: View Job Status of a Restore Operation
get.description: Returns the status of the specified restoration operation for a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Job ID of the restoration operation.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes, for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description:
Returns the backup configuration for the MySQL Cloud Service instance. The information includes:
  • Default retention time for incremental backups and full on-demand backups; full scheduled backups are retained until their last related incremental backup is no longer available
  • Schedule for full backups
  • Schedule for incremental backups
  • Date and time of the last successful backup
  • Date and time for the next scheduled backup (both full and incremental)
  • Total cloud storage container used for backups and total backup volume used

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

post.description:
Updates the backup configuration for a MySQL Cloud Service instance. Specifically, you can update the following details:
  • Schedule for full and incremental backups
  • Default retention time for incremental backups and full on-demand backups; note that full scheduled backups are retained until their last related incremental backup is no longer available, if any
  • Storage Cloud Service URI and user name for the container that is used to store backups

To disable a full or incremental backup, set the fullBackupSchedule or incrementalBackupSchedule value, respectively, to null. For example: {"fullBackupSchedule": null}.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the details of the backup configuration update request. Specify only those attributes that you want to update.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other HTTP status codes.

get.description:
Returns health monitoring data for the specified MySQL Cloud Service instance.

Monitoring information is provided at the following levels:

  • Service instance
  • Component (mysql)
  • Virtual Machine (vmInstances)
  • MySQL Server
The query parameter format is required, and the only supported format now is v1.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the health data. The only supported format for health data is v1.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description:
Returns detailed information about SSH keys for one or more MySQL Cloud Service instances as determined by the query parameters you provide.

By default, a single request returns a maximum of 50 keys. Use the serviceName query parameter to limit the results to a single service, use the limitRowCount query parameter to control maximum number returned, and use the offset query parameter to fetch additional results, if available. All query parameters are optional.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description:
Returns summary information about SSH keys for one or more MySQL Cloud Service instances as determined by the query parameters you provide.

By default, a single request returns a maximum of 50 keys. Use the serviceName query parameter to limit the results to a single service, use the limitRowCount query parameter to control maximum number returned, and use the offset query parameter to fetch additional results, if available. All query parameters are optional.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns summary information about the SSH key for a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

post.description: Adds an SSH public key to a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the details of the SSH public key name and value.

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns detailed information about the SSH key for a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description:
Returns information about all access rules defined for a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

The access rules that control external access to the MySQL Server, and MySQL Enterprise Monitor are disabled by default. To gain access to the administration consoles, you are required to explicitly enable the access rules for them.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

post.description: Adds (inserts) a new access rule to a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the details of the access rule to add.

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other HTTP status codes.

put.summary: Enable, Disable, or Delete an Access Rule
put.description: Disable, enable, or delete an access rule only. You cannot change the rule details.

parameters.name: ruleName
parameters.description: Name of the access rule to enable, disable, or delete. Must start with a letter, followed by letters, numbers, hyphens, or underscores. Must not exceed 50 characters, and is unique to the service.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the details of the disable, enable, or delete request.

200.description: OK (enable or disable rule). See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

202.description: Accepted (delete rule). See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns information about all the storage snapshots of a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

post.description:
Creates a snapshot of the storage volumes of a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

With every snapshot that you take of a service instance, the billable block storage will increase by the total size of all the volumes attached to the instance. For example, if an instance has 100 GB of block storage volumes, the first snapshot will increase the billable block storage for the instance to 200 GB, the second snapshot will increase the billable block storage to 300 GB, and so on.

After creating a snapshot, use the same endpoint for creating a service instance to create the service instance clone.

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns information about a storage snapshot of a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: snapshotName
parameters.description: Name of the snapshot.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

delete.description:
Deletes a storage snapshot of a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

Note: A snapshot cannot be deleted if there are any MySQL Cloud Service instances cloned from it.

parameters.name: snapshotName
parameters.description: Name of the snapshot.

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description:
This endpoint is not available in accounts where regions are not supported. It is also not applicable to service instances created on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

Returns information about the IP reservations created for MySQL Cloud Service in the given identity domain. Both used and unused IP reservations are returned.

Use the optional ?networkType query parameter to get details of all the IP reservations or only those that can be assigned to instances associated with IP networks.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: networkType
parameters.description:
Allowed values (case-sensitive):
  • ALL: Get details of all the IP reservations.
  • IPNetwork: Get details of only those IP reservations that can be assigned to instances attached to IP networks.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

post.description:
This endpoint is not available in accounts where regions are not supported. It is also not applicable to service instances created on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

Creates an IP reservation for MySQL Cloud Service in the identity domain. Only one IP reservation can be created at a time. If a create activity is already in progress, you cannot initiate another create request.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the IP reservation to create.

202.description:
Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

The Location header returns a URI that can be used to view the job status, as described in View the Status of an Operation by Job Id.

delete.description:
This endpoint is not available in accounts where regions are not supported. It is also not applicable to service instances created on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

Deletes an IP reservation created in MySQL Cloud Service. Only unused IP reservations can be deleted. If a delete activity is already in progress, you cannot initiate another delete request.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: ipResName
parameters.description: Name of the unused IP reservation to delete. To retrieve the name, see View All IP Reservations.

202.description:
Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

The Location header returns a URI that can be used to view the job status, as described in View the Status of an Operation by Job Id.

409.description: Conflict. Returned if the IP reservation is in use. The message displayed is: The IP Reservation [ip_reservation_name] is already in use by service [service_instance_name].

get.description:
Returns all activity in the specified identity domain ID.

Use one or more optional query parameters to filter the result. To pass a list of values for a parameter, repeat the parameter in the expression. For example: ?status=RUNNING&status=FAILED

By default the result is presented in descending order by startDate.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: Gets all activity for a specific service instance name.

parameters.name: fromStartDate
parameters.description:
Gets all activity created after a specific date.

Supported date formats are yyyy-MM-dd, yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

Can be used along with toStartDate to get activity created within a date range.

parameters.name: toStartDate
parameters.description:
Gets all activity created before a specific date.

Supported date formats are yyyy-MM-dd, yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

Can be used along with fromStartDate to get activity created within a date range.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Gets all activity for a specific status. For example: SUCCEED, FAILED, RUNNING and so on.

Repeat the parameter to pass a list of values.

parameters.name: operationType
parameters.description:
Gets all activity for a specific type of operation. For example: CREATE_SERVICE, DELETE_SERVICE, SCALE_OUT, STOP_SERVICE, START_SERVICE, ADD_SERVICE_RESOURCE, BACKUP and so on.

Repeat the parameter to pass a list of values.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
Sorts the results by a field name, in ascending or descending order.

Use the format field_name:sort_order. Valid values for the sort order are: asc or desc.

For example: ?orderBy=serviceName:asc

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.summary: View the Status of an Operation by Job Id
get.description: Returns information about an operation, including activity messages, by a job identifier.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Job ID of the operation. This is returned in the response header of the operation request.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.description: Returns information about an operation, including activity messages, by an activity log identifier.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: logId
parameters.description: Activity log ID of the operation.

200.description: OK. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

post.description:
Create a MySQL Cloud Service instance.

Service instance clones: You can create a clone of an existing MySQL Cloud Service instance, but you must first create a snapshot of the service instance you want to clone. See Snapshots REST Endpoints.
