patch-available-response.description: The response body contains information about the available patches.

availablePatchGuiMetadata.description: Instruction to the metadata GUI about the patch.

supportsPreCheck.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch supports precheck operations.

patchCategory.description: Category of the patch. For example: General, Upgrade, Multiple, Security, and so on.

patchSeverity.description: Severity of the patch. For example Normal, Mandatory, Recommended, and so on.

includesConfigUpgrade.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch includes a configuration upgrade.

patchReleaseUrl.description: URL that provides more information about the patch.

serviceType.description: Type of MySQL Cloud Service, which is MySQLCS.

serviceVersion.description: MySQL Cloud Service instance version to which the patch can be applied. For example: 5.7, Any, where Any indicates that the patch can be applied to any version.

releaseDate.description: Date and time the patch was released.

entryDate.description: Date and time the patch was created.

entryUserId.description: Name of the entity that created the patch.

componentPatches.description: Group the details of each patches in the component.

patchComponents.description: Group the details of the patch to be applied.

requiresRestart.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch requires a restart of the service instance.

serviceTypeVersions.description: MySQL Cloud Service instance version to which the patch can be applied. For example: 5.7, Any, where Any indicates that the patch can be applied to any version.

isDeleted.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch has been deleted and is no longer available. The information about the patch is not removed from the list of available patches in order to maintain an historical record of all patches.

isCustomerVisible.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch is visible.

isAutoApply.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch can be applied automatically.

induceDownTime.description: Flag that indicates whether the executing the patch causes service downtime.

metaVersion.description: The release version of metadata service manager.

supportedStrategy.description: Supported patching strategy. For example: In Place.

releaseVersion.description: Release version of the component in this patch.

patchCustomActions.description: List of customer actions during patching.

patch-component-details-info.description: Group the details of each patch in the component.

releaseVersion.description: Release version of the component in this patch.

displayName.description: Display name of the component in this patch.

zipBundles.description: Zips that contain the patched binaries or patches.

preserveFiles.description: List of files to be preserved during patching.

patch-component-applied-info.description: Group the details of the patch to be applied.

component.description: Name of the component in this patch. For example, mysql.

md5sum.description: Checksum used to validate the patch binary.

provisioningObjectRef.description: Location of binary to use when creating a new service instance.

patchingObjectRef.description: Location of binary to use when patching a service instance.

preserveFiles.description: List of files to be preserved during patching.

patch-zip-bundle-info.description: Group the details of zips for the patched binaries.

md5sum.description: Checksum used to validate the patch binary.

provisioningObjectRef.description: Location of binary to use when creating a new service instance.

storageKey.description: Location of the patch zip on the cloud.

zipVersion.description: Software version that is included in the zip.

releaseUrl.description: URL for more information about this release.

patch-apply-request-request.description: The request body contains information about the patch request. All attributes are optional.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patch request.

patch-accepted-response.title: Response Body
patch-accepted-response.description: The response body contains information about the operation.

message.description: System message that describes the operation. For example: Submitted job to create service [{serviceId}] in domain [{identityDomainId}].

patch-applied-all-response.description: The response body includes details of all applied patches.

backupStatus.description: Whether a backup of the software was created before the patch was applied. Valid values include: Available, SameVersion, Unavailable, Unknown.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patch.

appliedBy.description: Name of the user that applied the patch. system displays if the patch was applied by an auto-update scheduled job.

appliedDate.description: Date and time that the patch was applied.

patchReleaseUrl.description: URL that provides more information about the patch.

releaseDate.description: Date and time patch was released.

lastStatus.description: Status of the patch operation. For example: IN PROGRESS, COMPLETED, and FAILED. COMPLETED_ROLLBACK is displayed when an applied patch has been rolled back.

lastStatusMessage.description: Last message logged for the patch operation.

componentPatches.description: Group the details of each patches in the component.

patchComponents.description: Group the details of the patch to be applied.

patchCategory.description: Category of the patch. For example: General, Multiple, Security, and so on.

patchSeverity.description: Severity of the patch. For example Normal, Mandatory, Recommended, and so on.

jobId.description: Job ID for the patch operation.

toVersion.description: Version of Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance that was patched.

backupId.description: Backup ID. You can use the backup ID to manage the backup.

inProgress.description: Flag that specifies whether the patch is still in progress.

operationType.description: Patch operating being performed. Valid values include: Rollback, Patching, and None.

id.description: Unique ID of the patching operation. Use this ID to get details of a patching operation.

rollbackId.description: ID of the rollback that is associated to the completed patching operation. The ID is used to rollback a patch operation.

rollbackVersion.description: Version to which the patched component will be rolled back.

currentPatchLevel.description: Current patch level for the component.

progressMessages.description: List of progress messages for the patch.

patch-result-info.description: Groups information about the results of the patch.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the rollback.

patchingId.description: ID of the applied patch operation.

backupId.description: Backup ID. You can use the backup ID to manage the backup.

versionBeforeThisPatch.description: Version of the component before the patch was applied.

strategy.description: Patching strategy. For example, Rolling. To minimize service disruption, the patch is applied in a rolling pattern, patching a single node at a time.

metaVersionBeforeThisPatch.description: Version of the metadata service manager before the patch was applied.

customRollbackId.description: ID to be used in a rollback operation.

startDate.description: Date and time that the patch operation started.

patchingStatus.description: Status of the patching operation. For example, COMPLETED. COMPLETED_ROLLBACK is displayed when an applied patch has been rolled back.

resultMessage.description: System message that describes the patching operation.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patch.

appliedBy.description: Name of the user that applied the patch. system displays if the patch was applied by an auto-update scheduled job.

jobId.description: Job ID for the patch operation.

completeLog.description: System messages that track the patch operations.

progressMessages.description: List of progress messages for the patch.

patch-rollback-result.description: Groups information about the results of the rollback operation. This attribute displays only when a rollback of the patch had been performed.

startDate.description: Date and time that the rollback operation started.

patchingStatus.description: Status of the rollback operation. For example, COMPLETED_ROLLBACK.

resultMessage.description: System message that describes the rollback operation.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the rollback.

appliedBy.description: Name of the user that performed the rollback.

jobId.description: Job ID for the rollback operation.

completeLog.description: System messages that track the rollback operations.

progressMessages.description: List of progress messages for the rollback.

patch-rollback-request.description: The request body defines details about the rollback request.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the rollback.

patch-precheck-view-response.description: The response body includes information about the patch precheck. When viewing all patching prechecks, the response body includes information about all patch prechecks executed on this service instance.

jobId.description: Job ID for the patching precheck operation.

startDate.description: Date and time that the patching precheck operation started.

endDate.description: Date and time that the patching precheck operation stopped.

performedBy.description: Name of the user account used to perform the patch precheck.

inProgress.description: Flag that specifies whether the patch precheck is still in progress.

status.description:
Status of the patching precheck operation. Valid values include:
  • PASSED_PRECHECK - Patching precheck passed.
  • DIDNT_PASS_PRECHECK - Patching precheck did not pass. Check the preCheckMessages attribute for more information.
  • DIDNT_FINISHED_PRECHECK - An internal error was encountered and the patching precheck could not be performed.

href.description: URL for checking the status of the patching precheck job. This attribute displays only when viewing all patching precheck operations.

preCheckMessages.description: List of patching precheck messages. No patching precheck messages are returned when the precheck completes successfully.

resultMessage.description: System messages. This attribute displays only when viewing the status of one patching precheck operation.

alltagsassignments-response.description: The response body contains information about all tags and their assignments.

items.description: Groups details of tags and their assignments.

tagsassignments-response.description: The response body contains information about all tags and their assignments.

tagsassignments-details.description: Each object describes a tag and its assignments.

isExternalTag.description:
Flag to identify an account tag.

This property is only shown if the value is true.

isMeteringTag.description:
Flag to identify an account tag that is used for metering.

This property is only shown if the value is true.

state.description:
Whether a tag is created or is in the process of being deleted. Possible values: Ready, Deleting

This property is not shown when you use the Create and Assign Tags endpoint or Create and Delete Assignments endpoint.

assignments.description: Groups assignment details for this tag.

services.description: Groups the service resources assigned with this tag.

assignments.description: Groups the tag assignments to create.

services.description:
Groups the service resources to tag.

With instance tags, each new tag created is assigned to each service resource.

With account non-metering tags, each tag is assigned to each service resource.

tags.description:
Groups the instance tags to create.

For account non-metering tags, groups the tags to assign.

Each tag object is a key/value pair.

tagscreate-request.description:
Each tag is a key/value pair.

For account non-metering tags, specify the existing tag key and value for assignment.

key.description: Specify the key for this instance tag to create. A tag key can contain letters, numbers, dashes (-), and underscores ( _ ), and it can contain up to 128 characters.

value.description:
Specify the value for this instance tag to create. A tag value can contain up to 256 characters and is case-sensitive.

Default value is an empty string (if you do not provide a specific value).

tagsToDelete.description: Groups the tags to delete. Each tag object is a key/value pair.

value.description:
Value for this tag.

Default value is an empty string (if you do not provide a specific value).

serviceName.description: Name of the service instance to tag (or untag).

serviceType.description:
Type of service.

For example, MySQL for a MySQL Cloud Service instance and DBaas for a Database Cloud Service deployment.

serviceassignment-details.description: Each object describes a service resource.

assignmentState.description:
Whether tag assignment or unassignment is in progress. Possible values: Assigning, Unassigning, Assigned

This property is not shown when you use the Create and Assign Tags endpoint or Create and Delete Assignments endpoint.

serviceType.description:
Type of service.

For example, MySQL for a MySQL Cloud Service instance and DBaas for a Database Cloud Service deployment.

createAssignmentsTo.description: Groups the resources for tag assignments.

services.description: Groups the service resources to assign tags to. The tags are specified in tagsToAssign.

tagsToAssign.description: Groups the tags to assign. Each tag object is a key/value pair.

deleteAssignmentsFrom.description: Groups the resources for tag unassignments.

services.description: Groups the service resources to unassign tags from. The tags are specified in tagsToUnassign.

tagsToUnassign.description: Groups the tags to unassign. Each tag object is a key/value pair.

details.description: Groups details of a bad request, not found response, or conflict response.

backup-ondemand-request.description: The request body contains information about the on-demand backup operation. There are no required attributes.

keepForever.description: Flag that specifies whether to keep the backup forever. Otherwise, full on-demand backups are retained for the default retention period defined in the backup configuration.

notes.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the backup.

backup-accepted-response.title: Response Body
backup-accepted-response.description: The response body contains information about the operation.

operationName.description: Name of the operation. For example: start-backup, restore-backup, or delete-backup.

target_uri.description: Target URI. Poll the URI to get the target information or status of the operation.

backupId.description: Backup ID. You can use the backup ID to manage the specific backup (for example, download).

backupStartDate.description: Date and time that the backup started.

backupCompleteDate.description: Date and time that the backup completed.

expirationDate.description: Date and time that the backup will be deleted automatically from storage. If specify keepForever in backup request, the backup is retained indefinitely or until manually deleted.

deletedOnDate.description: Date and time that the backup deletion completed.

initiatedBy.description: User account that initiated this operation. If the operation is a scheduled automated backup, the value is scheduled.

full.description: Flag that specifies whether this is a full (true) or incremental (false) backup. A full backup contains all the data files required to restore the service instance databases. An incremental backup contains only changes to the databases since the last scheduled full backup.

local.description: Flag that specifies whether the backup is to be downloaded and stored locally (true), or archived and stored remotely on the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container (false).

localCopy.description: Flag that specifies whether the local copy of a backup is maintained for a backup that has been uploaded to the Oracle Storage Cloud Service.

databaseIncluded.description: This should always false for Oracle MySQL Cloud Service.

size.description: Size of the backup, in MBs. For example: 1011.4MB (backup complete) or Unknown (backup in-progress).

sizeInBytes.description: Size of the backup, in Bytes.

status.description: Status of the backup. Valid values include: Completed, Failed, Deleted, Backup In Progress, Upload In Progress, Download In Progress, Restore In Progress, or Delete In Progress.

jobHistory.description: Groups job history details. The job history details only return for a specific backup request.

fullBackup.description: Full backup linked to the incremental backup.

incrementalBackups.description: List of incremental backups linked to the full backup, if any.

notes.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the backup.

backup-view-all-response.description: The response body contains information about all backups.

backupInProgress.description: Groups the backups currently in progress, if any.

lastFailedBackup.description: Groups the failed backups, if any.

startTime.description: Date and time (as epoch) that the backup started.

endTime.description: Date and time (as epoch) that the backup completed.

startLSN.description: The beginning LSN of the backup.

endLSN.description: The last LSN of the backup.

lastBinLog.description: The name of the last binlog file.

triggeredBy.description: The user account that initiated this operation. If the operation is a scheduled automated backup, the value is scheduled.

operation.description: Type of operation that was executed. For example, backup, delete, upload, download, and so on.

status.description: Status of the backup. Valid values include: Completed, Failed, Deleted, Backup In Progress, Upload In Progress, Download In Progress, Restore In Progress, or Delete In Progress.

startDate.description: Date and time the operation started.

completeDate.description: Date and time that the operation completed.

statusDetails.description: History of system messages. Each message is separated by an ellipses {...}.

backup-delete-request.description: The request body defines the details of the delete backup request. You must specify at least one attribute.

backupId.description: ID of the backup that you want to delete.

backupIdList.description: List of backup IDs that you want to delete. If the list contains the ID for a full backup, all of its related (non-deleted) incremental backups must be included the list.

backup-view-deleted-response.description: The response body contains information about a backup deleted synchronously or asynchronously, or a list of backups deleted asynchronously.

delete-backup.description: Groups information about a deleted backup.

delete-backups.description: Groups information about a list of backups deleted asynchronously.

backup-view-all-deleted-response.description: The response body contains information about all deleted backups.

operation.description: Type of operation that was executed. Set to delete.

jobId.description: Job ID for the delete backup operation.

status.description: Status of the delete backup operation. Valid values include: Completed, Failed, Deleted, or Delete In Progress.

startDate.description: Date and time the delete backup operation started.

completeDate.description: Date and time the delete backup operation completed.

statusDetails.description: History of system messages. Each message is separated by an ellipses {...}.

backup-restoration-post-request.description: The request body defines the details of the restoration request.

restoreType.description: The type of restore to perform. The only supported value is PIT (point-in-time). Do not define restoreType if using a backup ID instead of a timestamp.

restoreId.description: For a point-in-time restoration, specify the timestamp value here. This PIT timestamp must be a valid UTC date using the MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM:SS format. For example, 03/12/2016 17:20:55.

backupId.description: Backup ID of the backup to restore. This is the only required field if restoring by a backup ID instead of a timestamp.

notes.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the restoration operation. There is a maximum length of 255 characters.

backup-view-all-restorations-response.description: The response body contains the details of the restoration operations.

restoreInProgress.description: Groups details of a restoration operation currently in progress, if any.

backupDate.description: Date and time of the backup.

restoreType.description: Defined for Point-In-Time (PIT) restorations, the only supported value is pit (Point-In-Time).

restoreId.description: Defined for Point-In-Time (PIT) restorations, its timestamp is displayed as MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM:SS. For example, 03/12/2016 17:20:55.

jobId.description: Job ID for the restore operation.

recoveryStartDate.description: Date and time that the restoration operation started.

recoveryCompleteDate.description: Date and time that the restoration operation completed. This information is not displayed for restorations that are still in progress.

status.description: Status of the operation. Valid values include: Completed, Failed, or Restore In Progress.

notes.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the restoration operation.

backup-config-response.description: The response body includes information about the backup configuration. If an update request was initiated and successfully completed, the response body shows the updated configuration.

defaultRetention.description:
Number of days incremental backups and full on-demand backups are retained. This value defaults to 30.

Full scheduled backups are retained until their last related incremental backup is no longer available, if any.

scheduledBackups.description: Type of scheduled backups. Only value is ALL. This means both full and incremental scheduled backups are enabled.

extendedRestoreTypes.description: Only value is pit. This means that point-in-time restoration is also supported, in addition to restoration by using a backup ID.

lastBackupDate.description:
Date and time that the last backup completed.

Note: If there have been no backups, this attribute is omitted.

nextFullBackupDate.description: Scheduled date and time for next full backup.

nextIncrementalBackupDate.description: Scheduled date and time for next incremental backup.

lastSuccessfulCleanupDate.description: Date and time that the last successful cleanup job completed. The cleanup job is run after the scheduled backup for the day is completed. The cleanup job purges old records, deletes expired backups. If there have been no cleanups, this attribute is omitted.

localRetention.description:
Number of days to retain the copies of backup on a dedicated storage volume. Default is 7 days.

The local retention value cannot be larger than the default retention value (specified by defaultRetention).

Copies of full scheduled backups are retained until the local copy of their last related incremental backup is no longer available, if any.

Any change to the local retention value will affect new backup copies as well as existing copies. This means if you change the value to a smaller number, existing backup copies that meet the updated retention policy will be deleted during the next backup or next scheduled maintenance cycle.

backupDestination.description: Location of the backups; BOTH - Disk and Oracle Storage Cloud Service Container, OSS - Cloud Storage Only, or NONE. The default is NONE.

cloudStorageContainer.description: Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container that is used to store backups.

cloudStorageUser.description: User name to access the specified Oracle Storage Cloud Service container.

totalCloudStorageContainerUsed.description: Total amount, in MBs, of the Storage Cloud Service container space that is currently in use.

totalCloudStorageContainerUsedInBytes.description: Total amount, in Bytes, of the Storage Cloud Service container space that is currently in use.

totalBackupVolumeUsed.description: Total amount, in MBs, of the backup volume that is currently in use.

totalBackupVolumeUsedInBytes.description: Total amount, in Bytes, of the backup volume that is currently in use.

percentBackupVolumeUsed.description: Total percent of the backup volume that is currently in use.

second.description: Seconds. This value is not configurable. It defaults to 0.

dayOfMonth.description: Day of the month. This value is not configurable. It defaults to all days of the month with is an astrisk (*).

month.description: Month. This value is not configurable. It defaults to all months with an astrisk (*).

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week. Valid values are: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun. For full backups, only one value (day) is allowed. For incremental backups, one or more values (days) are allowed. If a value is not specified for incremental backups, the default value is calculated as all days except the day that full backups are initiated.

year.description: Year. This value is not configurable. It defaults to all years (*).

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week. Valid values are: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun. For full backups, only one value (day) is allowed. For incremental backups, one or more values (days) are allowed. If a value is not specified for incremental backups, the default value is calculated as all days except the day that full backups are initiated.

backup-config-post-request.description: The request body defines the details of the backup configuration update request.

defaultRetention.description:
Number of days incremental backups and full on-demand backups are retained. This value defaults to 30.

Full scheduled backups are retained until their last related incremental backup is no longer available, if any.

Any change to the default retention value will affect new backups as well as existing backups. This means if you change the value to a smaller number, existing backups that meet the updated retention policy will be deleted during the next backup or next scheduled maintenance cycle.

localRetention.description:
Number of days to retain the copies of backup on a dedicated storage volume. Default is 7 days.

The local retention value cannot be larger than the default retention value (specified by defaultRetention).

Copies of full scheduled backups are retained until the local copy of their last related incremental backup is no longer available, if any.

Any change to the local retention value will affect new backup copies as well as existing copies. This means if you change the value to a smaller number, existing backup copies that meet the updated retention policy will be deleted during the next backup or next scheduled maintenance cycle.

monitor-response.description: The response body includes health monitoring information.

timestamp.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

serviceId.description: ID of the MySQL Cloud Service instance.

status.description: Status of the instance. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

domainName.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

components.description: Groups the health details for MySQL Cloud Service components.

serviceType.description: Type of the MySQL Cloud Service instance.

statusMessage.description: Status of the MySQL Cloud Service instance. For example, Running.

serviceName.description: Name of the MySQL Cloud Service instance.

message.description: Message about the component level health metrics collection.

serviceId.description: ID of the MySQL Cloud Service instance.

vmInstances.description: The health details of each Virtual Machine (VM) associated with the MySQL Cloud Service component.

componentType.description: Type of the component. For example, mysql.

timestamp.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

status.description: Status of the VM. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

servers.description: The health details of MySQL server(s) running on a VM.

label.description: Labels of the VM. For example, mysql, MYSQL_SERVER.

healthData.description: The health summary of the VM.

Data_Volume_Utilization.description: Total data storage used in percent.

Machine_Free_Memory.description: Total free memory in the VM.

timestamp.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

status.description: Status of the VM. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

healthData.description: The health summary of the MySQL Server.

MySQL_Requests_Per_Sec.description: Number of MySQL requests per second.

MySQL_UpTime_Sec.description: Time in seconds the MySQL server is running.

MySQL_Open_Connections.description: Number of open connections to the MySQL server.

statusMessage.description: VM status, such as Running or Stopped

unit.description: Unit measurement of the metric. For example, MB, seconds.

value.description: Value of the health monitoring data.

displayName.description: Display name for the health monitoring runtime metric.

ssh-get-key-response.description: The response body contains details about one or more SSH keys.

items.description: Array of JSON objects, with one element containing SSH key details for each key returned.

hasMore.description:
Indicates whether more keys are available to be requested, with the value true indicating that more are available.

When true, use the offset query parameter to fetch additional results. By default, offset is 0 (zero) and limitRowCount is 50.

totalResults.description: Number of SSH keys returned by this request.

ssh-get-key-items.description: The details of one SSH key.

identityDomain.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service account.

serviceType.description: Cloud service type. This value is MySQLCS for Oracle MySQL Cloud Service.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance.

credName.description: Credential name. The only supported credential name is vmspublickey.

credType.description: Credential type. The only supported value is SSH.

lastUpdateTime.description: Date and time the SSH key was last updated. For example, 2017-09-21T18:10:09.006+0000.

lastUpdateStatus.description: Status of the last update for the SSH key.

lastUpdateMessage.description: Message returned from the last update for the SSH key. For example: newly created, updated by username.

osUserName.description: Compute virtual machine OS user name. The only supported value is opc.

computeKeyName.description: The fully qualified name of the SSH Key object in Oracle Compute Cloud Service where the SSH public key value is stored.

publicKey.description: Public key for the secure shell (SSH). This key is used for authentication when connecting to the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance using an SSH client.

description.description: Credential description of the credential name.

serviceState.description: State of the service instance. For example, RUNNING.

ssh-get-key-description-response.description: The response body contains general information about one or more SSH keys (including their descriptions).

items.description: General information for each SSH key.

hasMore.description:
Flag that specifies whether the list returned by the query is full (false) or partial (true).

When the list is partial, use the offset query parameter to fetch additional results. By default, offset is 0 (zero) and limitRowCount is 50.

totalResults.description: Number of results returned by the query.

ssh-key-description-item.description: The details of one SSH key.

identityDomain.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service account.

serviceType.description: Cloud service type. This value is MySQLCS for Oracle MySQL Cloud Service.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance.

credName.description: Credential name. The only supported credential name is vmspublickey.

credType.description: Credential type. The only supported value is SSH.

description.description: Credential description of the credential name.

canonicalUrl.description: URL to query the SSH key value.

ssh-get-key-details-response.description: The details of one SSH key.

identityDomain.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service account.

serviceType.description: Cloud service type. This value is MySQLCS for Oracle MySQL Cloud Service.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance.

credName.description: Credential name. The only supported credential name is vmspublickey.

credType.description: Credential type. The only supported value is SSH.

lastUpdateTime.description: Date and time the SSH key was last updated. For example, 2017-09-21T18:10:09.006+0000.

lastUpdateStatus.description: Status of the last update for the SSH key.

lastUpdateMessage.description: Message returned from the last update for the SSH key. For example: newly created, updated by username.

osUserName.description: Compute virtual machine OS user name. The only supported value is opc.

computeKeyName.description: The fully qualified name of the SSH Key object in Oracle Compute Cloud Service where the SSH public key value is stored.

publicKey.description: Public key for the secure shell (SSH). This key is used for authentication when connecting to the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance using an SSH client.

description.description: Credential description of the credential name.

ssh-add-key-post-request.description: The request body defines the SSH public key value to add.

public-key.description: The value of the SSH public key, with any slashes (/) it contains preceded by backslashes, as in \/.

ssh-add-key-response.description: The response body contains information about the add SSH key operation.

access-rules-view-response.description: The response body contains information about the access rules.

activities.description: Groups details about ongoing and failed activity messages, if available.

status.description: Status of the rule. Valid value: disabled or enabled.

source.description: The hosts from which traffic is allowed. For example, PUBLIC-INTERNET for any host on the Internet, a single IP address or a comma-separated list of subnets (in CIDR format) or IPv4 addresses.

destination.description: The service component to allow traffic to. For example, mysql_MASTER.

ports.description: Ports for the rule. This can be a single port or a port range.

protocol.description: Communication protocol for the rule. For example, tcp.

ruleType.description: Type of rule. For example, SYSTEM, DEFAULT, or USER.

status.description: Status of the rule. Valid value: disabled or enabled.

source.description: The hosts from which traffic is allowed. For example, PUBLIC-INTERNET for any host on the Internet, a single IP address or a comma-separated list of subnets (in CIDR format) or IPv4 addresses.

destination.description: The service component to allow traffic to. For example, mysql_MASTER.

ports.description: Ports for the rule. This can be a single port or a port range.

protocol.description: Communication protocol for the rule. For example, tcp.

ruleType.description: Type of rule. For example, SYSTEM, DEFAULT, or USER.

activity.description: Groups messages and errors for ongoing and failed activities.

errors.description: Error encountered for an ongoing or failed activity.

message.description: Message of an ongoing or failed activity.

operation.description: Type of operation to perform on the access rule. Valid values are: update (to disable or enable a rule) and delete (to delete a rule).

status.description: State of the access rule to update to. This attribute is required only when you disable or enable a rule. Valid values are disabled or enabled.

view-all-snapshots.title: Response Body
view-all-snapshots.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element each for snapshot.

cloneCount.description: Number of service instances created from the snapshot.

timestamp.description: The date-and-time stamp when the snapshot was created.

status.description: Status of the snapshot: In Progress or Succeeded.

opInProgress.description: In-progress operation of the snapshot: RemoveSnapshot or Clone.

opStatusMessage.description: Status message of the snapshot: Snapshot In Progress, Clone In Progress, Remove Snapshot In Progress, or Snapshot Succeeded.

cloneCount.description: Number of service instances created from the snapshot.

timestamp.description: The date-and-time stamp when the snapshot was created.

cloneServices.title: clonedServices Array
cloneServices.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element for each service instance created from the snapshot.

metadata.description: Number of service instances created from the snapshot.

status.description: Status of the snapshot: In Progress or Succeeded.

opStatusMessage.description: Status message of the snapshot: Snapshot In Progress or Snapshot Succeeded.

creationTime.description: The date-and-time stamp when the snapshot was created.

status.description: Status of the cloned service: INITIALIZING, READY, or TERMINATING.

releaseVersion.description: Name of the cloned service instance.

service-accepted-response.title: Response Body
service-accepted-response.description: The response body contains information about the operation.

message.description: System message that describes the operation. For example: Snapshot a service [{serviceId}] is submitted as an asynchronous job.

ipres-response.description: The response body contains information about used and unused IP reservations.

activities.description: Groups details about ongoing and failed activity messages, if available.

ipResName.description: Name of the IP reservation to create.

region.description: Name of the region to create the IP reservation in.

networkType.description:
Indicates whether the IP reservation is for instances attached to IP networks or the shared network.
  • If you intend to assign this reservation to an instance attached to an IP network, then specify IPNetwork.
  • If you intend to use this reservation for an instance attached to the shared network, then omit this parameter.

jobId.description: Job ID of the create operation.

accountId.description: The identity domain ID and service type of the service. For example, myidentitydomain_MySQLCS, where MySQLCS is the service type of MySQL Cloud Service.

creationTime.description: Date and time the IP reservatione was created.

hostName.description: Name of the Managed Server or Load Balancer node that is using the named IP reservation. This attribute is returned only when the IP reservation is in use.

ipAddress.description: The public IP address for the IP reservation.

networkType.description: Indicates whether the IP reservation is intended for instances attached to IP networks or the shared network.

serviceName.description: Name of the MySQL Cloud Service instance where the named IP reservation is used. This attribute is returned only when the IP reservation is in use.

status.description: Status of the IP reservation. Valid values: INITIALIZING, UNUSED, USED.

activity.description: Groups messages and errors for ongoing and failed activities.

errors.description: Error encountered for an ongoing or failed activity.

message.description: Message of an ongoing or failed activity.

ipResName.description: Name of the unused IP reservation to be deleted.

jobId.description: Job ID of the delete operation.

authDomain.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

authUser.description: Name of the user account used to perform the operation on the MySQL Cloud Service instance.

endDate.description: Date and time the job ended.

identityDomain.description: Identity domain ID for the MySQL Cloud Service account.

initiatedBy.description: Value is USER when the job is initiated by a service end user.

jobId.description: Job ID returned by the Location URI in the response header when the operation request was made.

operationType.description: Type of operation. For example, CREATE_SERVICE, SSH_PUBLIC_KEY_RESET, CONFIG_CHANGE, and so on.

serviceId.description: ID of the MySQL Cloud Service instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the MySQL Cloud Service instance.

serviceType.description: Cloud service type. Valid value is MySQLCS for MySQL Cloud Service.

startDate.description: Date and time the job started.

status.description: Status of the job. Example status messages include: RUNNING, SUCCEED, and FAILED.

summaryMessage.description: Operation type. For example, CREATE_SERVICE, SSH_PUBLIC_KEY_RESET, CONFIG_CHANGE, and so on.

activityDate.description: Date and time the activity was logged.

filter-response.description: The response body contains activity information.

service-create-instance-request.title: Create Instance Request Body
service-create-instance-request.description: Root schema for the nested 'serviceParameters' and 'componentParameters' schemas for the create instance operation. See the nested schema definitions for paramter details.

gettags-responsem.description: The response body contains tagging information.

isPlacementTag.description: Flag that identifies this tag as a service instance placement tag.

isExternalTag.description:
Flag that identifies this tag as an account tag.

This property is only shown if the value is true.

isMeteringTag.description:
Flag that identifies this tag as an account tag that is used for metering.

This property is only shown if the value is true.

state.description: Whether a tag has been created or is in the process of being deleted. Possible values: Ready, Deleting

assignments.description: Groups assignment details for this tag.

assignmentState.description: Whether tag assignment or unassignment is in progress. Possible values: Assigning, Unassigning, Assigned

serviceType.description:
Type of service.

For example, MySQLCS for a MySQLCS Service instance and DBaas for a Database Cloud Service deployment.

service-create-instance-service-paramete.title: MySQL Cloud Service Parameters
service-create-instance-service-paramete.description: Define service parameters for the create instance operation.

serviceName.description:
Name of MySQL Cloud Service instance. The service name:
  • Must not exceed 50 characters.
  • Must start with a letter.
  • Must contain only letters, numbers, or hyphens.
  • Must not end with a hyphen.
  • Must not contain any other special characters.
  • Must be unique within the identity domain.

serviceDescription.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the service instance.

meteringFrequency.description: The billing frequency of the service instance; either MONTHLY or HOURLY.

availabilityDomain.description:
This required attribute is only available on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. region is also required; subnet is optional.

Name of a data center location in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure region that is specified in region. A region is a localized geographic area, composed of one or more availability domains (data centers).

The availability domain value format is an account-specific prefix followed by <region>-<ad>. For example, FQCn:US-ASHBURN-AD1 where FQCn is the account-specific prefix.

See Regions and Availability Domains in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Services.

backupDestination.description:
Backup destination. Valid values are:
  • BOTH - Both Cloud Storage and Local Storage
  • OSS - Cloud Storage Only
  • NONE - None
. The default is NONE.

cloudStorageContainer.description:
URI of the object storage container or bucket for storing MySQL Cloud Service instance backups. This attribute is not required if backupDestination is set to NONE.

Note:

  • Do not use a container or bucket that you use to back up MySQL Cloud Service instances for any other purpose. For example, do not also use the same container or bucket to back up Oracle Database Cloud Service database deployments. Using one container or bucket for multiple purposes can result in billing errors.
  • You do not have to specify a container or bucket if you provision the service instance without enabling backups.

On Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic, the object storage container does not have to be created ahead of provisioning your MySQL Cloud Service instance.

To specify the container (existing or new), use one of the following formats:

  • Storage-<identitydomainid>/<containerName>
  • <storageservicename>-<identitydomainid>/<containerName>
  • <restEndPointURL>/<containerName>

To identify the REST endpoint URL of your object storage service, see Finding the REST Endpoint URL for Your Service Instance in Using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic.

On Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, the object storage bucket must be created before provisioning your MySQL Cloud Service instance. Do not use the same bucket for more than one instance. For the instructions to create a bucket, see Prerequisites for Oracle Platform Services on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure documentation. Enter the bucket URL in the following format:

https://swiftobjectstorage.<region>.oraclecloud.com/v1/<namespace>/<bucket>.

To find out your namespace, sign in to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure web console, click the tenancy name, and look for the Object Storage Namespace field.

Example:

https://swiftobjectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/v1/acme/mybucket

cloudStorageUser.description:
User name for the object storage user. The user name must be specified if cloudStorageContainer is set.

On Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic, this is the user name for the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic user who has read and write access to the container that is specified in cloudStorageContainer.

cloudStoragePassword.description:
Password for the object storage user. The password must be specified if cloudStorageContainer is set.

On Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic, this is the password for the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic user who has read and write access to the container that is specified in cloudStorageContainer.

cloudStorageContainerAutoGenerate.description:
This attribute is not applicable when provisioning a MySQL Cloud Service instance in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

Flag that specifies whether to create (true) or not create (false) the object storage container if the name specified in cloudStorageContainer does not exist. The default is false.

enableNotification.description:
Flag that specifies whether to enable (true) or disable (false) notifications by email. If this property is set to true, you must specify a value in notificationEmail.

Currently, notifications are sent only when service instance provisioning is successful or not successful.

ipNetwork.description:
This attribute is applicable only to accounts where regions are supported.

This attribute is not applicable when provisioning MySQL Cloud Service instances in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

The three-part name of a custom IP network to attach this service instance to. For example:

/Compute-identity_domain/user/object

A region name must be specified in order to use ipNetwork. Only those IP networks already created in the specified Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic region can be used.

A consequence of using an IP network is that the auto-assigned IP address could change each time the service instance is started. To assign fixed public IP addresses to a service instance that is attached to an IP network, you can first create reserved IP addresses, then provision the service instance to use those persistent IP addresses in ipReservations. Note that to use ipReservations, assignPublicIP must be true.

See IP Reservations REST Endpoints for information about how to find unused IP reservations and, if needed, create new IP reservations.

notificationEmail.description:
The email that will be used to send notifications to.

To receive notifications, enableNotification must be set to true.

noRetry.description: This parameter, when set to true disables the provisioning retry in case of failures.

region.description:
This attribute is only applicable to accounts where regions are supported, including accounts on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

Name of the region where the MySQL Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.

(Not applicable on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure) A region name must be specified if you intend to use ipReservations or ipNetwork.

An Oracle Cloud Infrastructure region must be specified to provision your service instance on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure host resources. Be sure to specify a region that is within the default data region of your account on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. If the default data region is North America, specify the region such as us-phoenix-1 or us-ashburn-1. If the default data region is EMEA, specify the region as eu-frankfurt-1 or uk-london-1.

Note the following when provisioning on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure:

  • An availability domain must also be specified using availabilityDomain. See Regions and Availability Domains in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Services.
  • A subnet can be specified using subnet. See VCNs and Subnets in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Services. If subnet is not specified, a subnet is automatically assigned to this MySQL Cloud Service instance from a virtual cloud network (VCN) named svc-vcn in the ManagedCompartmentForPaaS compartment.
  • Access rules and IP reservations REST endpoints are not supported.

vmUser.description: VM operating system user that is valid for variations of compute based services. It will default to the username opc when not specified.

vmPublicKeyText.description: Public key for the secure shell (SSH). This key will be used for authentication when connecting to the MySQL Cloud Service instance using an SSH client. You generate an SSH public-private key pair using a standard SSH key generation tool.

service-create-instance-component-parame.title: MySQL Server Component Root Schema
service-create-instance-component-parame.description: Contains the nested 'mysql' schema for the request body of the create instance operation.

service-create-instance-parameters.title: MySQL Server Component Parameters
service-create-instance-parameters.description: Parameters for the 'mysql' schema defined in componentParameters as part of the create instance operation.

shape.description:
Desired compute shape. A shape defines the number of Oracle Compute Units (OCPUs) and amount of memory (RAM). Valid shapes include:
  • oc3: 1 OCPU, 7.5 GB memory
  • oc4: 2 OCPUs, 15 GB memory
  • oc5: 4 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc6: 8 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc7: 16 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc1m: 1 OCPU, 15 GB memory
  • oc2m: 2 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc3m: 4 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc4m: 8 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc5m: 16 OCPUs, 240 GB memory
.

See About Shapes in Using Oracle Compute Cloud Service for more information about shapes.

mysqlUserName.description: Administration user for connecting to the service via the MySQL protocol. User name should start with a letter, consist of letters and numbers, and be between 2 to 32 characters. The default is root.

mysqlUserPassword.description:
Password for MySQL administration user. The password must meet the following requirements:
  • Starts with a letter
  • Is between 8 and 30 characters long
  • Contains letters, at least one number, and optionally, any number of these special characters: dollar sign ($), pound sign (#), and underscore (_).

mysqlPort.description: Port for the MySQL server. Port must be in the range of 3200-3399. The default is 3306.

mysqlEMPort.description: Port for the MySQL Enterprise Monitor. The default is 18443.

dbStorage.description: Storage volume size for MySQL data. The number must be between 25 and 1024 GB. Default value is 25.

dbName.description: Initial database schema name of your choice, up to 64 characters; can contain letters, numbers and special characters (_,$). The default name is mydatabase.

mysqlCharset.description: MySQL server character set. See Supported Character Sets and Collations for the character sets MySQL supports. Although the MySQL Server 5.7 default is 'latin1', MySQL Cloud Service sets this to 'utf8mb4' by default.

mysqlTimezone.description: MySQL server time zone. The default value is SYSTEM, which indicates that the server time zone is the same as the system time zone. The value can be given as a named time zone, such as 'Europe/Paris', 'US/Eastern', or 'Asia/Shanghai'. See MySQL Server Time Zone Support for related information.

mysqlCollation.description: MySQL server collation. See Supported Character Sets and Collations for the permissible collations of each character set.

mysqlOptions.description: MySQL server options and variables. Only comma separated key value pairs with no spaces are permitted (e.g., option1=value,option2=value). MySQL server options that are available as MySQL Server Component Parameters, such as mysqlPort, are not permitted in a mysqlOptions string. See Server System Variables for information about MySQL server options.

sourceServiceName.description: When present, indicates that the service instance should be created as a "snapshot clone" of another service instance. Provide the name of the existing service instance whose snapshot is to be used. dbName, mysqlCharset, mysqlCollation, mysqlEMPort, enterpriseMonitor, and associated MySQL server component parameters do not apply when cloning a service from a snapshot. For those parameters, the clone operation uses the values defined in the snapshot of the source service instance.

subnet.description:
This optional attribute is only applicable when provisioning MySQL Cloud Service instances on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. region and availabilityDomain, however, are required.

The Oracle Cloud Identifier (OCID) of a subnet from a virtual cloud network (VCN) created on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

You can specify a subnet that you have created yourself, or you can let MySQL Cloud Service automatically assign a subnet for you.

To specify a subnet you have created: Use subnet to specify the OCID of the subnet from a VCN that you have created on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. For the instructions to create a VCN and subnet, see Prerequisites for Oracle Platform Services on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure documentation. The OCID is a unique autogenerated ID. To find out the OCID of the subnet, go to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure web console, select the Networking tab, click the VCN that your subnet is in, and look for the OCID field under the subnet that you want to use.

To let MySQL Cloud Service assign a subnet for you: Do not include subnet in your provisioning request payload. When excluded, MySQL Cloud Service automatically assigns a subnet from the VCN named svc-vcn in the ManagedCompartmentForPaaS compartment.

snapshotName.description: The name of the snapshot of the service instance specified by sourceServiceName that is to be used to create a "snapshot clone". This parameter is valid only if sourceServiceName is specified.

enterpriseMonitor.description: Indicate whether to configure MySQL Enterprise Monitor during provisioning. The value can only be one of the valid choices, either Yes or No and the default is No.

enterpriseMonitorManagerUser.description: Name for the Enterprise Monitor manager user. Manager User name should start with a letter, consist of letters and numbers, and be between 2 to 32 characters.

enterpriseMonitorManagerPassword.description: Password for MySQL Enterprise Monitor manager. The password must be at least 8 characters long with at least one lower case letter, one upper case letter, one number and one special character.

enterpriseMonitorAgentUser.description: Name for the Enterprise Monitor agent user. Agent User name should start with a letter, consist of letters and numbers, and be between 2 to 32 characters.

enterpriseMonitorAgentPassword.description: Password for MySQL Enterprise Monitor agent. The password must be at least 8 characters long with at least one lower case letter, one upper case letter, one number and one special character.

service-view-all-instances.title: View All Instances Response
service-view-all-instances.description: Root schema for the response body that contains information for all service instances.

services.title: All MySQL Cloud Service Instances
services.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element for each MySQL Cloud Service instance in the identity domain.

serviceId.description: ID of the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance.

serviceType.description: Type of the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance, such as MySQLCS.

domainName.description: The identity domain housing the service instance.

serviceVersion.description: The major version of MySQL Server. For example, 5.7.

region.description: Region where the service instanced is provisioned.

releaseVersion.description: The release version of MySQL Server. For example, 5.7.20.

metaVersion.description: The release version of metadata service manager.

serviceLevel.description: The service level of the service instance. For example, PAAS for Oracle Cloud Service.

subscription.description: The subscription type of the service instance; either MONTHLY or HOURLY.

meteringFrequency.description: The billing frequency of the service instance; either MONTHLY or HOURLY.

edition.description: The edition of MySQL Server. For example, EE.

attributes.description: Array of the service attributes. For example, MYSQL_PORT, CLOUD_STORAGE_CONTAINER, LOCAL_BACKUP_VOLUME_SIZE, etc.

activityLogs.title: Root Activity Log Schema
activityLogs.description: Activity log for the service instance.

serviceLevelDisplayName.description: The display name of the service level. For example, Oracle MySQL Cloud Service.

editionDisplayName.description: The display name of MySQL Server edition. For example, Enterprise Edition.

meteringFrequencyDisplayName.description: The display name of the metering frequency; either Monthly or Hourly.

DATA_VOLUME_SIZE.description: Storage volume size for MySQL data.

MYSQL_PORT.description: The listener port for MySQL server.

BACKUP_DESTINATION.description: Backup destination; either BOTH - Both Cloud Storage and Local Storage, or NONE - None.

CLOUD_STORAGE_CONTAINER.description: Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container used to provide storage for MySQL service instance backups.

LOCAL_BACKUP_VOLUME_MOUNT.description: The volume mount point for local backups.

LOCAL_BACKUP_VOLUME_SIZE.description: Storage volume size for MySQL local backups.

totalSharedStorage.description: The total shared storage size; always 0 for MySQL Cloud Service.

serviceStateDisplayName.description: The display name of the service current state.

computeSiteName.description: The Oracle Cloud location housing the service instance.

serviceId.description: ID of the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service instance.

state.description: The current state of the component.

version.description: The version of the component. For example, 5.7.

creationDate.description: The date and time when the service instance was created.

instanceName.description: The component name of the service instance. For example, mysql.

instanceRole.description: The role of the service instance. It is None for Oracle MySQL Cloud Service.

attributes.description: Array of service component attributes, such as compute shape, connect string, etc.

adminHostName.description: The host name of the administration node. It is usually the instance itself.

storageVolumes.description: All storage volumes of the service instance.

isKeyBinding.description: Indicates whether the attribute is key binding.

vmId.description: The ID of the compute node.

hostname.description: The host name of the compute node.

label.description: The label of the compute node.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the compute node.

publicIpAddress.description: The IP address of the compute node.

usageType.description: The usage type of the compute node. It is usually MYSQL_SERVER for Oracle MySQL Cloud Service.

role.description: The role of the compute node. It is usually MYSQL_SERVER for Oracle MySQL Cloud Service.

componentType.description: The type of the component. It is usually mysql for Oracle MySQL Cloud Service.

state.description:
The current state of the compute node. Valid values are:
  • Ready: Fully operational
  • Starting: Being created or initialized
  • Stopping: Being stopped
  • Error: Has some error condition(s)

shapeId.description: The Oracle Compute Cloud shape of the compute node.

totalStorage.description: The size in GB of the total storage allocated to the compute node, including data volume, backup volume, and MySQL log volume.

creationDate.description: The date and time when the service instance was created.

isAdminNode.description: Indicates whether the compute node is an administration node.

storageVolumes.description: All storage volumes of the service instance.

vmStateDisplayName.description: The display name of the current state of the compute node.

partitions.description: Number of partitions of the storage volume.

serverType.description: Type of the server, such as MASTER.

creationDate.description: Date and time when the server was created.

service-change-instance-status-request.title: Status Change Request Body
service-change-instance-status-request.description: Defines details for the stop, start or restart operations.

force.description: Flag used to force the request.

allServiceHosts.description: When true, this will control all hosts in the service.  When provided, the 'hosts' array(s) should be empty.

hosts.description: A list of hosts to control. Note that the service is controlled if ALL hosts are listed, making this the same behavior as including 'allServiceHosts': true

activityLogId.description: The log ID of the operation.

serviceType.description: The service type of the instance.

identityDomain.description: The identity domain hosting the instance.

serviceId.description: The corresponding ID of the MySQL Cloud Service instance.

jobId.description: The ID of the current job.

startDate.description: The date and time when the job started.

endDate.description: The date and time when the job ended.

status.description: Current status of the job; one of: In Progress, Succeeded, Failed.

operationId.description: The corresponding ID of the operation.

operationType.description: The type of the operation, such as CREATE_SERVICE.

summaryMessage.description: The summary of the activity log.

authDomain.description: Identity domain for the Oracle MySQL Cloud Service account.

service-message-item.title: Service Message Details
service-message-item.description: Details for a specific service message log.

activityDate.description: The date and time of the current activity.

service-scale-post-request.title: Scaling Request Body
service-scale-post-request.description: Defines component parameters for the scaling operation. See the nested 'components' schema for details.

service-scale-components-post-request.title: Scaling Component Details
service-scale-components-post-request.description: Details for the 'components' schema in the scaling operation.

shape.description:
Desired compute shape. A shape defines the number of Oracle Compute Units (OCPUs) and amount of memory (RAM). Valid shapes include:
  • oc3: 1 OCPU, 7.5 GB memory
  • oc4: 2 OCPUs, 15 GB memory
  • oc5: 4 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc6: 8 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc7: 16 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc1m: 1 OCPU, 15 GB memory
  • oc2m: 2 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc3m: 4 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc4m: 8 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc5m: 16 OCPUs, 240 GB memory

See About Shapes in Using Oracle Compute Cloud Service for more information about shapes.

hosts.description: A list of hosts to control.

service-delete-instance-put-request.title: Delete Operation Request Body
service-delete-instance-put-request.description: The request body defines options for this delete MySQL instance operation. There are no available options.

options.description: This operation does not yet accept any options; you are required to define this as an empty object '{}'.

service-add-storage-post-request.title: Add Storage Request Body
service-add-storage-post-request.description: Defines component parameters for the add storage operation. See the nested 'components' schema for details.

service-add-storage-components-post-requ.title: Add Storage Component Details
service-add-storage-components-post-requ.description: Details for the 'components' schema in the add storage operation.

dataStorage.description: Amount of data storage (GB), from 10 to 2000. This becomes the new dataStorage value. The current value can be increased, but not decreased.

backupStorage.description: Amount of backup storage (GB), from 50 to 2000. This becomes the new backupStorage value. The current value can be increased, but not decreased.

MySQLLogStorage.description: Amount of redolog storage storage (GB), from 60 to 2000. This becomes the new MySQLLogStorage value. The current value can be increased, but not decreased.

hosts.title: Hosts with Added Storage
hosts.description: A list of hosts to control by this add storage operation. For example, a common host name format is instancename-mysql-1 where instancename is the name of the particular MySQL Cloud Service instance.
